subject: South Korea April 1st-20th exports rose 8.3% Y/Y, while imports rose 20.8% Y/Y
South Korea says it stopped propaganda broadcasts at border with North Korea

PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: North Korea announced it will stop nuclear and ICBM testing effective April 21st and will start dismantling a nuclear test site in the north
content:
AUSTRALIA

AMP Capital (AMP AT)
- Reports noted that revenue from Co. financial planning fees more than doubled despite introduction of laws which were aimed at protecting consumers by banning unreasonable charges by financial planners. (AFR)

BHP (BHP AT)
- Brazil court approves an extension by around 2 months for Co. to continue negotiations for settlement of claims related to Samarco Dam failure. (Newswires)

Challenger Financial Services Group (CGF AT)
- Co. was said to have approached Paradice Investment Management earlier in the year but was rebuffed. (AFR)

Downer EDI (DOW AT)
- Co. is said to be considering divestment of mining services business. (The Australian)

Galaxy Resources (GXY AT)
- Co. Q1 ore mined 480.5K tons vs. Prev. 395.0K tons Q/Q. (Newswires)

Macquarie Atlas Group (MQA AT)
- Co. names Graeme Bevans as CEO elect. (Newswires)

Macquarie Group (MQG AT)
- Co. is said to be mulling sale of Calon Energy which is the owner of 3 gas-fired power stations in UK. (Newswires)

Macquarie Infrastructure (MIG AT)
- Group of US-based shareholders is said to be calling for Co. board to be removed and liquidation of the Co. (AFR)

Mirvac (MGR AT)
- Co. Q3 total MAT growth in retail sales was 3.5% Y/Y. (Newswires)

Santos (STO AT)
- Total (FP FP) and Macquarie are said to be mulling bidding for the Co. (Newswires)

Westpac (WBC AT)
- Co. former financial planner who was reprimanded by the Royal Commission for ripping off clients, said he is being made a scapegoat by the bank which "squeezed" him for revenue. (AFR)

Financials
- ANZ (ANZ AT), AMP (AMP AT) and NAB (NAB AT) are all to provide evidence in the Royal Commission inquiry to bad financial advice. (AFR)

 

JAPAN

CyberAgent (4751 JT)
- Co. is said to cancel plan for cryptocurrency exchange. (Newswires)

Fuji Electric Holding (6504 JT)
- Co. expected to report a record operating profit for FY 17/18. (Newswires)

Konica Minolta (4902 JT)
- Co. oper. profit is expected to increase 20% to over JPY 60bln for this fiscal year. (Nikkei)

Tokyo Steel (5423 JT)
- Co. reports FY17/18 parent net JPY 11.3bln vs. Prev. JPY 11.1bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 164.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 121.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Toshiba (6502 JT)
- Co. is said to weigh options including the cancellation of its chip unit sale if it doesn’t get Chinese approval for the deal by late-May. (Newswires)

Other News
- BoJ is speculated by some to be reducing the number of ETFs it purchases as the bank was said to have bought ETFs nearly all occasions the Topix fell over 0.2% in early trade during the past year. However, this month the bank has only purchased on one such occasion out of the 3 different times it occurred. (Nikkei)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Korean Air Lines (003490 KS)
- Co. Chairman Cho has removed his daughters from their roles at the Co. following behaviour issues and has issued an apology. (Newswires)

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS)
- Co. is mulling roll out of new Galaxy smartphones in China to restore market share in the country. (Newswires)

Washing machine makers
- South Korean washer exports to US are said to decline by over 45% Y/Y due to US tariffs. (Newswires)

Geopolitical
- North Korea announced it will stop nuclear and ICBM testing effective April 21st and will start dismantling a nuclear test site in the north. (Newswires)
- US President Trump expected to tell North Korea leader Kim that nuclear dismantling must precede economic benefits, while a senior administration official stated that North Korea will have to earn lifting of sanctions. (WSJ)

subject: UK and South Korea officials are in discussions to preserve tax breaks on North Sea crude purchases post-Brexit
China is to promote stock connects, according to press reports
NDRC says China is planning further steps to reduce business costs this year
PBoC Governor Yi Gang said that China's financial sector remains sound with risks broadly contained, according to reports in Xinhua

US President Trump expected to tell North Korea leader Kim that nuclear dismantling must precede economic benefits, while a senior administration official also stated that North Korea will have to earn lifting of sanctions, according to reports in WSJ
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights Include Japanese Nikkei Manufacturing PMI, New Zealand Credit Card Spending and Singapore CPI
South Korean washer exports to US are said to decline by over 45% Y/Y, due to US tariffs
Samsung Electronics (005930 KS) mulling roll out of new Galaxy smartphones in China to restore market share in the country
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA

Singapore PM Lee is expected to announce a reshuffle of his cabinet this week, which is said to target giving younger ministers more responsibility. (Newswires)
 

UK

UK Chancellor Hammond said remaining in the customs union is not the best solution for the UK but should still seek close ties with EU following Brexit. (Newswires)

Senior Brexiteers are said to be concerned and have warned that PM is supporting a hybrid plan for post-Brexit relationship with EU that would make trade deals with other countries impossible and in which the UK would collect customs duties on EU’s behalf for goods to the EU. (Telegraph)

UK PM May’s team reportedly privately admitted that the UK may have to accept permanent membership of a European customs union. (Times)


EU

Sources reported that ECB normalisation path not affected by the recent string of soft data and stated that QE is still to end by the end of 2018. (Newswires)

ECB’s Villeroy said despite a slowdown in Q1 growth, there will be a solid or improved economic recovery in France during upcoming 2 or 3 years. (Newswires)

Fitch upgraded Cyprus to 'BB+'; Outlook Positive. (Newswires)


FX

Mexico Central Bank Governor Diaz de Leon said that MXN weakness does not require intervention. (Newswires)

Canadian CPI Inflation MM (Mar) 0.3% vs. Exp. 0.4% (Prev. 0.6%). (Newswires)
Canadian CPI Inflation YY (Mar) 2.3% vs. Exp. 2.4% (Prev. 2.2%)


COMMODITIES

US Baker Hughes Total Rig Count (20 Apr) 1013 (Prev. 1008). (Newswires)

OPEC Secretary General Barkindo said that there is no price objective to OPEC or in a deal with non-OPEC members and highlighted the objective is to restore stability, which followed an earlier tweet by President Trump that oil prices are artificially very high which he noted was no good and will not be accepted. (Newswires)


GEOPOLITICAL

North Korea announced it will stop nuclear and ICBM testing effective April 21st and will start dismantling a nuclear test site in the north. (Newswires)
 

US

US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin said that the US is continuing dialogue with China and are cautiously optimistic on reaching an agreement. Mnuchin added he may possibly visit China, although he suggested that nothing was confirmed and that it was being considered. (Newswires)

Fed's Brainard (Voter, Dovish) reiterated view on gradual hikes and said that the economy is solid but noted uncertainties around the outlook given international trade. (Newswires)

Fed's Williams (Voter, Hawkish) said neutral rate appears much lower than in the past and that he expects 'new normal' for Fed's balance sheet to be around USD 3trln. Furthermore, Williams said that stronger global growth lifts demand for US exports which helps to reduce disinflationary pressures. (Newswires)

Fed's Evans (Non-Voter, Dovish) said if inflation rises faster than expected it is a sign of a stronger economy that can withstand further rate increases, while he added that gradual rate hikes continue to be appropriate. (Newswires)

Fed's Kashkari (Non-Voter, Dovish) is said to be surprised the long-end of the curve has risen further after fiscal stimulus and is also surprised by the flatness of the yield curve, which he said warrants caution. (Newswires)


MARKET RECAP

Futures were trading sub-2700 pre-cash open on Friday and sank after the cash day got underway, with AAPL weighing. While stocks were lower on the day, ESM8 contract is pretty-much flat on the week. YIELDS: Some suggested that stocks were under pressure after the latest bout of steepening along the Treasury curve, where yields on 10s approach cycle highs once again. Banks were said to benefit, and the financial sector was one of the better performers, albeit still red. TECH SECTOR: Apple (AAPL) was hit after concerns about weak iPhone demand, with losses exacerbated by a cut in price target at Morgan Stanley, weighing on the Dow and applying pressure to the tech sector (INTC, CSCO and MSFT all lower, and along with FB, all report Q1 numbers next week). EARNINGS: In earnings, Reuters reported that of the 87 S&P 500 companies to have reported thus far, 79% have beat expectations. GE’s results topped estimates and the co reiterated 2018 forecasts, propelling shares. Schlumberger (SLB) was lower on a mix of early oil price weakness as well as an average earnings report. SPX -0.9% at 2670, NDX -1.6% at 6666, DJI -0.8% at 24467.

It was another day of bear-steepening, with shorter dated yields rising by under 2bps, and long end yields higher by just over 3bps at settlement. But while the steepening curve was attributed for part of the jitters in stocks on Friday, actual curve spreads only saw modest widening (2s30s was were most of the action was at, and was only steeper by c.2bps). In post-settlement trade, the 10yr note rose to near 2.96, reaching levels last seen in 2014. The shape of the yield curve has attracted attention of Fed policymakers this week, once again; earlier, Bullard again shared concerns of yield curve inversion within the next six months. On Friday, Kashkari said he was surprised longer-dated yields hadn’t risen more considering US fiscal stimulus. Next week, the UST sells2s, 5s, and 7s. US 10yr T-Notes futures settles 9 ticks lower at 119-17+.

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
